choices.A: As an alternative to the summary command.
choices.D: To generate statistics on search-time fields.
choices.B: To generate statistics on indexed fields.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Use the tstats command to perform statistical queries on indexed fields in tsidx files. The indexed fields can be from indexed data or accelerated data models.

Because it searches on index-time fields instead of raw events, the tstats command is faster than the stats command.

questions.question_text: Repeating JSON data structures within one event will be extracted as what type of fields?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
the answer is multi value

Selected Answer: C
the other answer make no sense at all, A might be, but we're talking about repeating data structures

questions.question_text: Which of the following can be used to access external lookups?
Where does the output of an append command appear in the search results?

choices.D: Added to the end of the search results.
choices.B: Added as a column to the left of the search results.
choices.C: Added to the beginning of the search results.
choices.A: Added as a column to the right of the search results.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct, append command adds results of the subsearch in the end of the current result set.
appendpipe also does this
appendcols adds a new column

Selected Answer: C
| makemv [delim= | tokenizer=<regex>] <Field> 
you can use delimiter or regex. To use regex, use the tokenizer option.

questions.question_text: How is regex passed to the makemv command?

choices.C: It is specified by the tokenizer argument.
choices.A: makemv must be preceded by the erex command.
choices.B: It is specified by the delim argument.
choices.D: makemv must be preceded by the rex command.
